qas.question: What is another term used for White-box testing?
What is involved with White-box testing?
Which two procedures are used to design test cases in White-box testing?

answers.text: testing an internal perspective of the system, as well as programming skills

plausible_answers.text: clear box testing, glass box testing, transparent box testing and structural testing

qas.question: White-box data testing is also known by what other names?
An external perspective is used in white-box testing as well as what else is used to develop test cases?

plausible_answers.text: to exercise paths through the code and determine the appropriate outputs.

qas.question: The tester chooses outputs to accomplish what?
What is in-circulus testing also known as?

context: White-box testing (also known as <a0_0><b3_0>clear box testing<a0_0/>, glass box testing, transparent box testing and structural testing<b3_0/>, <a1_0>by seeing the source code<a1_0/>) tests internal structures or workings of a program, as opposed to the functionality exposed to the end-user. In white-box <a2_0>testing an internal perspective of the system, as well as <b4_0>programming skills<b4_0/><a2_0/>, are used to design test cases. The tester chooses inputs <b5_0>to exercise paths through the code and determine the appropriate outputs.<b5_0/> This is analogous to testing nodes in a circuit, e.g. in-circuit testing (<b6_0>ICT<b6_0/>).
